medical_history.chief_complaint: Fever and pain with swelling of both eyes and the right ear.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had been well until 6 weeks before admission when headache and fever developed. Symptoms persisted despite treatment for viral syndrome and sinusitis. He experienced neck pain and sinus congestion, followed by horizontal diplopia, pain above the eyes, and subsequently pain and swelling of the left eye with tearing. Two days before admission, he developed pain in the right ear.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of hypertension, angina, and presumed vitamin B12 deficiency. Usual medications include lisinopril, atenolol, isosorbide mononitrate, ranitidine, and monthly vitamin B12 injections.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had breast cancer; brother had hypertension.
medical_history.social_history: Native of Puerto Rico, lived in Boston for 30 years, married with grown children, worked as a mechanic, does not use tobacco, illicit drugs, or consume alcohol. Exposed to a family member with active tuberculosis in childhood.
